data.name: border
data.description: List of CSS Selectors for altering the border property of a DOM element.

parameters.name: border
parameters.description: Applies border on all sides.

parameters.name: border-top
parameters.description: Applies border on the top.

parameters.name: border-right
parameters.description: Applies border on the right.

parameters.name: border-bottom
parameters.description: Applies border on the bottom.

parameters.name: border-left
parameters.description: Applies border on the left.

parameters.name: border-none
parameters.description: Removes borer on the element.

parameters.name: circle
parameters.description: Applies a circular border radius of 50% on the element.

parameters.name: border-bottom
parameters.description: Applies border on the bottom.

data.name: reset
data.description: By default all anchors are applied a default style, with hover and other states picking up the accent from the chosen theme.

children.name: checkbox
children.description: A CSS styled checkbox component. Refer example below for usage.

parameters.name: data-el
parameters.description: Applied to the parent wrapping DOM element to target styling for the nested input[type='checkbox'] and the label for the checkbox.

parameters.name: data-el
parameters.description: Applied to the label for the checkbox to help toggling the state of the checkbox.

example.head: <link href="../dist/el-base-blue.min.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css">

children.name: radio
children.description: A CSS styled radio component. Refer example below for usage.

parameters.name: data-el
parameters.description: Applied to the parent wrapping DOM element to target styling for the nested input[type='radio'] and the label for the radio.

parameters.name: data-el
parameters.description: Applied to the label for the radio to help toggling the state of the radio.

example.head: <link href="../dist/el-base-blue.min.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css">

children.name: switch
children.description: Switch component which is a styled variant of the checkbox. Refer example below for usage.

parameters.name: data-el
parameters.description: Applied to the parent wrapping DOM element to target styling for the nested input[type='checkbox'] and the label for the checkbox.

parameters.name: data-el
parameters.description: Applied to the label for the checkbox to help toggling the state of the checkbox.

example.head: <link href="../dist/el-base-blue.min.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css">

children.name: accordion
children.description:
An accordion component which helps display nested level data with a grouped hierachical representation of a heading and content.
Comes in two variants. Open one at a time (when the nested input is of type radio) and (or) Open multiple (when the nested input is of type checkbox).
Refer example below for usage.

parameters.name: data-el
parameters.description: Applied to the parent wrapping DOM element to target styling for the nested input[type='checkbox'] or input[type='radio'] and the label for the checkbox or radio.

parameters.name: data-el
parameters.description: Applied to the label for the checkbox to help toggling the state of the checkbox.

example.html:
One at a time
Content 1
Content 2
Multiple
Content 1
Content 2
example.head: <link href="../dist/el-base-blue.min.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css">

children.name: dropdown
children.description:
Dropdown - is a component of type menu appearing below a menu title when it is selected, and remaining until used or dismissed.
Refer example below for usage.

parameters.name: data-el
parameters.description: Applied to the parent wrapping DOM element to target styling for the nested input[type='checkbox'] and the label for the checkbox.

parameters.name: data-el
parameters.description: Applied to the label for the checkbox to help toggling the state of the checkbox.

parameters.name: data-el
parameters.description: The overlay mask DOM element which un-sets the checkbox when clicked outside the dropdown panel.

parameters.name: data-el
parameters.description: DOM element which contains the contents of the dropdown panel.

example.html: Content
example.head: <link href="../dist/el-base-blue.min.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css">

data.name: button
data.description:
List of CSS Selectors for altering an element of type button or to make any element look like a button.
 Default input[type='button'] is not overriden to provide flexibility of styling.
 The accent's used for different states of the button is driven by the chosen theme.

parameters.name: btn
parameters.description: Applies styles to an element to make it look like a button.

properties.name: hover-none
properties.description: To disable hover effect on the button.

parameters.name: btn-primary
parameters.description:
Applies primary button style to an element.
  A primary style uses the base theme accent.
  The states for a primary button element is the same as default button.

parameters.name: btn-link
parameters.description:
Applies primary button style to an element.
  A primary style uses the base theme accent.
  THe states for a primary button element is the same as default button.

data.name: anchor
data.description: By default all anchors are applied a default style, with hover and other states picking up the accent from the chosen theme.

parameters.description: When no class is applied to an anchor it gets a default style based on the theme.

parameters.name: a-primary
parameters.description: This is a variant of the default anchor style.

data.name: fonts
data.description:
The CSS library uses OpenSans as a font-family of choice for all its typography.
This font-family is set on the body of the page & has the below three variants which can be set using CSS selectors.      

REGULAR: All typogrpahy used

parameters.name: REGULAR
parameters.description: The de-facto font-family for all t.

data.name: palette
data.description:
List of brushes available with the monochromatic palette.
Several utility chainable classes are available to target the brushes from the palette to properties on an element.

children.name: color
children.description: List of helper CSS selectors to target the color property of an element.

parameters.name: color-transparent
parameters.description: Transparent brush.

parameters.name: color-white
parameters.description: White brush.

parameters.name: color-white-90
parameters.description: White brush with alpha percentage of 90.

parameters.name: color-white-80
parameters.description: White brush with alpha percentage of 80.

parameters.name: color-white-70
parameters.description: White brush with alpha percentage of 70.

parameters.name: color-white-60

parameters.description: White brush with alpha percentage of 10.

parameters.description: Black brush.

parameters.name: color-green
parameters.description: Green / Success status brush.

parameters.name: color-amber
parameters.description: Amber / Warning status brush.

parameters.name: color-red
parameters.description: Red / Error status brush.

parameters.name: color-accent
parameters.description: Accent brush based on the chosen theme.

data.name: themes
data.description:
List of themes.
Under the monochromatic palette schema, a theme vairant is the choice of an accent brush that gets applied to various elements and their states.
To use a theme, a style-sheet of the relevant accent is appended to the head section of the page.

children.name: blue
children.description:
Blue theme / accent for the elements CSS library.
HEX: #1167a0

parameters.name: #1167a0
parameters.description: The hex for the Blue accent brush.

children.name: purple
children.description:
Purple theme / accent for the elements CSS library.
HEX: #6c4cfe

parameters.name: #6c4cfe
parameters.description: The hex for the Purple accent brush.
